channel.title: Tcl on OpenSees Examples
channel.description: Recent content in Tcl on OpenSees Examples

item.title: CableStayed02
item.description: The problem is implemented in the file CableStayedBridge.py, and can also be run through the Tcl file CableStayedBridge.tcl. This model is adapted from the opstool project and has been adapted to use the robust Model class interface.

item.title: Elastic Frame Example
item.description: This example is of an elastic frame structure, as shown in the figure, subject to static loads. Here is the file: ElasticFrame.

item.title: Euler buckling analysis
item.description: Corotational frame elements are used to approximate Euler’s buckling load, which is given by: \[ P_{\mathrm{euler}} = \frac{\pi^2 EI}{L^2} \] This example is adapted from https://github.

item.title: Example 1: Simple Truss
item.description: This example is of a linear-elastic three bar truss, as shown in the figure above, subject to static loads. The purpose of this example is to develop the basic requirements for performing finite element analysis with OpenSees.

item.title: Example 2: Moment-Curvature
item.description: This example covers the moment-curvature analysis of a reinforced concrete section. The zero-length element with a fiber discretization of the cross section is used in the model.

item.title: Example 3: Portal Frame Examples
item.description: This set of examples investigates the nonlinear analysis of a reinforced concrete frame. The nonlinear beam column element with a fiber discretization of the cross section is used in the model.

item.title: Example 4: Multibay Two Story Frame
item.description: In this example variables and control structures are demonstrated. Example 4.1 This example is of a reinforced concrete multibay two story frame, as shown in Figure 1, subject to gravity loads.

item.title: Example 5: Rigid 3D Frame
item.description: Example 5.1 A three-dimensional reinforced concrete rigid frame, is subjected to bi-directional earthquake ground motion. Example5.1.tcl RCsection.tcl Or for Python:

item.title: Example 6: Simply Supported Beam
item.description: In this example a simple problem in solid dynamics is considered. The structure is a simply supported beam modelled with two dimensional solid elements.

item.title: Example 7: Dynamic Shell Analysis
item.description: In this example a simple problem in shell dynamics is considered. The structure is a curved hoop shell structure that looks like the roof of a Safeway.

item.title: Example 8: Cantilever Beam
item.description: In this example a simple problem in solid dynamics is considered. The structure is a cantilever beam modelled with three dimensional solid elements.

item.title: Hayward Bridge
item.description: The Hayward bridge model is used for structural health monitoring on the BRACE2 platform. The files for the model can be browsed on GitHub.

item.title: Matrix Eigenvalue Analysis
item.description: Eigen analysis of a two-storey shear frame This example demonstrates how to perform eigenvalue analysis and plot mode shapes. Idealized two-storey shear frame (Example 10.
